It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant purple to pink flowers that bloom during the spring and summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
